mdRecord.dcterms:description: St. Andrew's Episcopal Church, originally known as Trinity Memorial Church is a Gothic style church built c.1907 in Denver, Colorado. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1975. Expanded in 2008 to a design in keeping with Cram's original plans for a larger church, St. Andrew's now seats 175 in a sanctuary that includes works by Denver artists Marion Buchan and Albert Byron Olson. The parish house is by Denver architect Jules Jacques Benedict. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St._Andrews_Episcopal_Church_%28Denver,_Colorado%29 [work]
